title: Installation
text: can know open RStudio install EDITH package running following code. can just copy-paste RStudio console hit Enter. installation complete, can load package running: üéâ don‚Äôt see error, now ready use EDITH package!  üîé information use , please refer vignettes: two drugs: https://mathilde-robin.github.io/EDITH/articles/two_drugs.html three drugs: https://mathilde-robin.github.io/EDITH/articles/three_drugs.html
code: if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("devtools") }  if (!requireNamespace("ComplexHeatmap", quietly = TRUE)) {     if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {         install.packages("BiocManager")     }     BiocManager::install("ComplexHeatmap") }  devtools::install_github("mathilde-robin/EDITH") library(EDITH)

title: Theory
text: Characterizing interactions drugs area major interest drug development, exploiting synergism drugs allow increasing treatment efficacy using lower doses single drugs, avoiding antagonistic interaction needed maintain therapeutic efficacy drugs. Broadly speaking, synergism antagonism defined increase reduction effect drug combination compared effect expected combination basis single agent effects. EDITH package enables synergistic effects two three drugs explored, based cell viability data obtained combination experiments. package designed analyze visualize drug interactions implements widely used method assessing drug interactions: Bliss independence model.

title: Theory
text: Bliss independence model mathematical framework used evaluate independence (ie. absence interaction effect) two drugs administered combination. general form Bliss independence model following equation: Ecombined=EA+EB‚àí(EA*EB)E_{combined} = E_A + E_B - (E_A * E_B) : EAE_A effect drug , EBE_B effect drug B, EcombinedE_{combined} expected effect drug combination. case cancer cell population, effect correspond fraction cells killed drug(s). example, drug kills 30% cells, EA=0.3E_A = 0.3 drug B kills 40% cells EB=0.4E_B = 0.4. According Bliss independence model, expected effect combination drugs B : Ecombined=0.3+0.4‚àí(0.3*0.4)=0.58E_{combined} = 0.3 + 0.4 - (0.3 * 0.4) = 0.58 means combination drugs B expected kill 58% cells act independently. Bliss equation can recast terms unaffected cells follows: Ucombined=UA*UBU_{combined} = U_A * U_B : UAU_A fraction unaffected cells drug (ie. viability treatment drug ), UBU_B fraction unaffected cells drug B (ie. viability treatment drug B), UcombinedU_{combined} expected fraction unaffected cells drug combination. example, drug leaves 70% cells unaffected, UA=0.7U_A = 0.7 drug B leaves 60% cells unaffected UB=0.6U_B = 0.6. According Bliss independence model, expected fraction unaffected cells combination drugs B : Ucombined=0.7*0.6=0.42U_{combined} = 0.7 * 0.6 = 0.42 means combination drugs B expected leave 42% cells unaffected act independently. generalized form Bliss equation combination n drugs : Ucombined=‚àè=1nUiU_{combined} = \prod_{=1}^n U_i : =1,...,ni = 1, ..., n indexes drugs combination, UiU_i fraction unaffected cells drug ii.

title: Theory
text: Interpr√©tation : - Synergie : Effet observ√© > Effet attendu - Additivit√© : Effet observ√© ‚âà Effet attendu - Antagonisme : Effet observ√© < Effet attendu Ensuite, il charge le package tidyverse pour la manipulation des donn√©es et la visualisation. Il d√©finit plusieurs fonctions pour effectuer des t√¢ches sp√©cifiques, telles que l‚Äôaffichage d‚Äôun message de bienvenue, le nettoyage des sous-tableaux, la v√©rification des donn√©es, le calcul de la matrice d‚Äôadditivit√© selon la m√©thode de Bliss, le calcul des indices synth√©tiques selon la m√©thode de Lehar, et la cr√©ation de graphiques de chaleur. Le script lit un fichier Excel s√©lectionn√© par l‚Äôutilisateur, extrait les noms des m√©dicaments et les donn√©es de chaque feuille de calcul, puis effectue les analyses pour chaque bloc de donn√©es (repr√©sentant un r√©plicat). Pour chaque bloc, il nettoie les donn√©es, effectue les v√©rifications n√©cessaires, calcule la matrice d‚Äôadditivit√© et les indices synth√©tiques, et g√©n√®re des heatmaps pour visualiser les r√©sultats. Enfin, il enregistre les graphiques dans des fichiers PDF et affiche un message si les doses des m√©dicaments ne sont pas coh√©rentes entre les r√©plicats. Le script est con√ßu pour √™tre interactif, avec des bo√Ætes de dialogue pour informer l‚Äôutilisateur des erreurs ou des avertissements, et pour lui permettre de choisir le fichier Excel √† analyser. Le script est con√ßu pour √™tre utilis√© dans un environnement R et n√©cessite que l‚Äôutilisateur ait les droits d‚Äô√©criture dans le r√©pertoire de sortie sp√©cifi√©. La formule de Bliss est utilis√©e pour √©valuer l‚Äôadditivit√© des effets de deux ou plusieurs m√©dicaments lorsqu‚Äôils sont administr√©s en combinaison. Elle repose sur l‚Äôid√©e que si deux m√©dicaments agissent ind√©pendamment l‚Äôun de l‚Äôautre, l‚Äôeffet combin√© devrait √™tre √©gal √† la somme des effets individuels de chaque m√©dicament. La formule de Bliss est g√©n√©ralement exprim√©e comme suit : En d‚Äôautres termes, si les m√©dicaments et B sont administr√©s s√©par√©ment, leurs effets individuels sont additionn√©s, mais l‚Äôeffet combin√© est ajust√© en soustrayant le produit de leurs effets individuels. Cela permet de tenir compte du fait que les m√©dicaments peuvent interagir de mani√®re additive ou synergique. La formule de Bliss est souvent utilis√©e dans les √©tudes pharmacologiques pour √©valuer si une combinaison de m√©dicaments produit un effet sup√©rieur √† celui attendu en fonction de leurs effets individuels. Si l‚Äôeffet combin√© est sup√©rieur √† celui pr√©dit par la formule de Bliss, cela sugg√®re une synergie entre les m√©dicaments. Si l‚Äôeffet combin√© est inf√©rieur, cela indique un antagonisme. La formule de Lehar est utilis√©e pour √©valuer l‚Äôefficacit√© des combinaisons de m√©dicaments en tenant compte de leur interaction. Elle est souvent utilis√©e dans le contexte de la pharmacologie pour quantifier l‚Äôeffet d‚Äôune combinaison de m√©dicaments par rapport √† leurs effets individuels. La formule de Lehar est g√©n√©ralement exprim√©e comme suit : CI = (E_A * E_B) / E_combined o√π : - CI est l‚Äôindice de combinaison, qui quantifie l‚Äôinteraction entre les m√©dicaments. - E_A est l‚Äôeffet du m√©dicament . - E_B est l‚Äôeffet du m√©dicament B. - E_combined est l‚Äôeffet combin√© des deux m√©dicaments lorsqu‚Äôils sont administr√©s ensemble. L‚Äôindice de combinaison (CI) est utilis√© pour √©valuer si l‚Äôeffet combin√© des m√©dicaments est sup√©rieur, inf√©rieur ou √©gal √† la somme de leurs effets individuels. Un CI sup√©rieur √† 1 indique une synergie entre les m√©dicaments, c‚Äôest-√†-dire que leur effet combin√© est sup√©rieur √† ce qui serait attendu en additionnant leurs effets individuels. Un CI √©gal √† 1 indique une additivit√©, tandis qu‚Äôun CI inf√©rieur √† 1 sugg√®re un antagonisme, o√π l‚Äôeffet combin√© est inf√©rieur √† la somme des effets individuels. La formule de Lehar est souvent utilis√©e dans les √©tudes pharmacologiques pour √©valuer l‚Äôefficacit√© des combinaisons de m√©dicaments, en particulier dans le contexte du traitement du cancer ou d‚Äôautres maladies o√π plusieurs m√©dicaments sont utilis√©s simultan√©ment. Elle permet aux chercheurs de mieux comprendre comment les m√©dicaments interagissent entre eux et d‚Äôoptimiser les sch√©mas th√©rapeutiques. Method: Index: According approach proposed Lehar (Leh√°r et al., 2007, 2008, 2009), point--point calculation expected values case absence interaction effect performed matrix concentration combinations order obtain expected-value matrix. , combination index, CI, calculated follows: CI=lnfAlnfB‚àë,B(M0‚àí)CI = \ln f_A \ln f_B \sum_{,B} (M_0 - M_E) MOM_O MEM_E matrices observed expected values, respectively, fAf_A fBf_B dilution factors drugs B. CI positive-gated, effect-weighted volume lack interaction effect (.e.¬†Bliss independence), adjusted variable dilution factors fAf_A fBf_B. efficacy index also calculated follow: EI=lnfAlnfB‚àë,BM0EI = \ln f_A \ln f_B \sum_{,B} M_0. Leh√°r, J., Zimmermann, G.R., Krueger, .S., Molnar, R.., Ledell, J.T., Heilbut, .M., Short, G.F., Giusti, L.C., Nolan, G.P., Magid, O.., et al.¬†(2007). Chemical combination effects predict connectivity biological systems. Mol. Syst. Biol. 3, 80. Leh√°r, J., Stockwell, B.R., Giaever, G., Nislow, C. (2008). Combination chemical genetics. Nat. Chem. Biol. 4, 674‚Äì681. Leh√°r, J., Krueger, .S., Avery, W., Heilbut, .M., Johansen, L.M., Price, E.R., Rickles, R.J., Short, G.F., Staunton, J.E., Jin, X., et al.¬†(2009). Synergistic drug combinations tend improve therapeutically relevant selectivity. Nat. Biotechnol. 27, 659‚Äì666. Note: MOM_O et MEM_E correspondent aux nombres de cellules mortes (et pas vivantes comme dans nos calculs ‚Ä¶)

title: Tutorial with 3 drugs
text: use EDITH package, need provide input file .xlsx format. file contain dose-response data two drugs. can find example file extdata folder package, found complete path running following code: Otherwise, can look snapshot example input file :   üî• criteria input file follows: file must .xlsx format. first cell (A1) must contain name drug rows (e.g., ‚ÄúDrug ‚Äù). second cell (B1) must contain name drug columns (e.g., ‚ÄúDrug B‚Äù). third cell (C1) must contain name drug layers (e.g., ‚ÄúDrug C‚Äù). second row must empty. third row must contain concentrations Drug B (starting cell B3). first column must contain concentrations Drug (starting cell A4). last column must contain concentrations Drug C block. drugs concentrations must increasing order, starting 0 drug consistent step size. rest cells must contain corresponding viability values 0 100 (values higher 100 set 100). üí° Note: multiple replicates experiment (ie. exactly drugs doses), can add sheet, just first experiment, one empty row . üí° Note: multiple experiments, can add additional sheets file, format. name sheet used name output files.
code: list.files(   path = system.file("extdata", package = "EDITH"),    pattern = ".xlsx", full.names = TRUE ) ## [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/EDITH/extdata/2drugs.xlsx" ## [2] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/EDITH/extdata/3drugs.xlsx"

title: Tutorial with 3 drugs
text: run_EDITH() --one function performs entire analysis pipeline, data preprocessing visualization results. loading EDITH package, can run function copy-pasting following code RStudio console hitting Enter: , can select input file want analyze via pop-window:  selecting file, function automatically process data, perform analysis, generate output files designated output folder. üí° Note: don‚Äôt need create output folder. created automatically running functions. create directory input file, name input file followed _output/.

title: Tutorial with 3 drugs
text: running run_EDITH() function, find output files output directory created automatically. example output directory structure input file 1 experiment (ie. 1 excel sheet line1), 2 replicates:   three drugs version EDITH, experiment replicate, analysis performed 3 possible drug permutations: Perm 1: drug B x-axis, drug y-axis, drug C varying. Perm 2: drug C x-axis, drug B y-axis, drug varying. Perm 3: drug x-axis, drug C y-axis, drug B varying.  Finaly, experiment, replicate drug permutation, obtain: One .pdf file three pages per concentration third drug, containing: heatmap visualizing viability data across different drug concentration combinations, heatmap visualizing expected viability based Bliss independence model, heatmap visualizing interaction effect concentration third drug. One .pdf file viability interaction heatmaps concentration third drug unique file.  One .xlsx file detailing additive, combination efficacy indexes concentration third drug.   üîé Fore details method, please refer theory vignette: https://mathilde-robin.github.io/EDITH/articles/theory.html

title: Tutorial with 2 drugs
text: use EDITH package, need provide input file .xlsx format. file contain dose-response data two drugs. can find example file extdata folder package, found complete path running following code: Otherwise, can look snapshot example input file :   üî• criteria input file follows: file must .xlsx format. first cell (A1) must contain name drug rows (e.g., ‚ÄúDrug ‚Äù). second cell (B1) must contain name drug columns (e.g., ‚ÄúDrug B‚Äù). second row must empty. third row must contain concentrations Drug B (starting cell B3). first column must contain concentrations Drug (starting cell A4). drugs concentrations must increasing order, starting 0 drug consistent step size. rest cells must contain corresponding viability values 0 100 (values higher 100 set 100). üí° Note: multiple replicates experiment (ie. exactly drugs doses), can add sheet, just first experiment, one empty row .  üí° Note: multiple experiments, can add additional sheets file, format. name sheet used name output files.
code: list.files(   path = system.file("extdata", package = "EDITH"),    pattern = ".xlsx", full.names = TRUE ) ## [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/EDITH/extdata/2drugs.xlsx" ## [2] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/EDITH/extdata/3drugs.xlsx"

title: Tutorial with 2 drugs
text: run_EDITH() --one function performs entire analysis pipeline, data preprocessing visualization results. loading EDITH package, can run function copy-pasting following code RStudio console hitting Enter: , can select input file want analyze via pop-window:  selecting file, function automatically process data, perform analysis, generate output files designated output folder. üí° Note: don‚Äôt need create output folder. created automatically running functions. create directory input file, name input file followed _output/.

title: Tutorial with 2 drugs
text: running run_EDITH() function, find output files output directory created automatically. example output directory structure input file 2 experiments (ie. 2 excel sheets line1 line2), 2 replicates :   obtain: One .pdf file per replicate (ie. per experiment per replicate): heatmap visualizing viability data across different drug concentration combinations, heatmap visualizing expected viability based Bliss independence model, heatmap visualizing interaction effect.  One .pdf file per experiment (ie. per excel sheet) viability interaction heatmaps replicates unique file.  One .xlsx file per experiment (ie. per excel sheet) detailing additive, combination efficacy indexes replicates.   üîé Fore details method, please refer theory vignette: https://mathilde-robin.github.io/EDITH/articles/theory.html

title: Evaluation of Drug Interactions in the setting of THerapy combinations

Example datasets included package illustrate required format (inst/extdata/2drugs.xlsx inst/extdata/3drugs.xlsx) can found command: snapshot input data format (excel file) two drugs:  üîé details vignettes: two drugs: https://mathilde-robin.github.io/EDITH/articles/two_drugs.html three drugs: https://mathilde-robin.github.io/EDITH/articles/three_drugs.html

title: Evaluation of Drug Interactions in the setting of THerapy combinations
text: run_EDITH() --one function performs entire analysis pipeline, data preprocessing visualization results. run_EDITH() function detects whether input data corresponds two-drug three-drug combination applies appropriate analysis methods accordingly. input file path specified via pop-window function executed.

title: Evaluation of Drug Interactions in the setting of THerapy combinations
text: main outputs EDITH package include: Heatmaps visualizing viability data across different drug concentration combinations, Heatmaps visualizing expected viability based Bliss independence model, Heatmaps visualizing interaction effect, Summary tables detailing additive, combination efficacy indexes. example heatmaps generated EDITH two-drug combinations:
